abstract: Attorney General Jerry Brown of California sued Wells Fargo on Thursday for $1.5 billion, contending that the bank had misled investors about the safety and liquidity of the auction-rate securities that it sold.
lead_paragraph: Attorney General Jerry Brown of California sued Wells Fargo on Thursday for $1.5 billion, contending that the bank had misled investors about the safety and liquidity of the auction-rate securities that it sold.

headline.main: California Sues Wells Fargo Over Securities Sales

abstract: California’s attorney general, Jerry Brown, said the bank lost $1.5 billion for investors who had purchased auction-rate securities.
snippet: California’s attorney general, Jerry Brown, said the bank lost $1.5 billion for investors who had purchased auction-rate securities.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  Joining a roster of state lawmen pursuing civil actions against banks, California’s attorney general, Jerry Brown, sued three subsidiaries of Wells Fargo on Thursday, claiming the bank had lost some $1.5 billion for investors in the state who bought auction-rate securities.

headline.main: California Sues Wells Fargo Over Securities Sales
headline.print_headline: California Sues Wells Fargo Over Securities
